section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The instrument cluster comprises various digital displays, e.g., a speedometer, time, range, temperatures as well as indicator and warning lights.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The layout of the instrument cluster adapts to the respective driving mode. The positions of some displays may vary, e.g., the selector lever display.
Some of the displays in the instrument cluster may differ from the illustrations in the Owner's Manual.
The view on the instrument cluster can vary depending on the selected driving mode. The driving mode is set using the M MODE button.
The following M MODE views are available:

item.paragraph: "ROAD": standard view of the instrument cluster for comfort-oriented driving. All displays for driver assistance systems and collision warning systems are enabled.
"SPORT": M View to assist a sporty driving style. The displays for driver assistance systems and collision warning systems are reduced to a minimum.
"TRACK": M View for driving on a race track. The driver assistance and collision warning system displays are deactivated.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
M MODE.

overview.overview-text: Failure of the displays on instrument cluster

warning.paragraph: If the displays on the instrument cluster fail, do not use the vehicle. There may be a risk of accident or risk of damage to property. Immediately park the vehicle in a safe manner. If drive readiness is switched off and on again, the malfunction may be rectified and it may be possible to continue driving. If the malfunction cannot be remedied, have the system checked by an authorized service center or by another qualified service center or a repair shop.

section.title: Overview
section.paragraph: Instrument cluster

section.title: Display ranges on the instrument cluster
Operating elements on the steering wheel

entry.paragraph: Display the menu bar on the instrument cluster.
Turn knurled wheel: scroll selection up or down.
Tilt knurled wheel in corresponding direction: Move selection to left or right.
Display the menu bar on the instrument cluster.
Press the corresponding arrow key to move the selection.
Turn knurled wheel: scroll selection up or down.

section.title: Configuring the layout
section.paragraph: In Personal Mode drive mode, the layout in the instrument cluster can be individually configured and displayed.
In COMFORT drive mode, the layout in the instrument cluster can be individually configured and displayed.

action-step.paragraph: Press the button on the steering wheel.
A menu bar is displayed in the instrument cluster.
Select the menu using the arrow buttons on the steering wheel where applicable.
Select the menu by tilting the thumbwheel on the steering wheel where applicable.
Select the desired setting using the thumbwheel on the steering wheel.

section.title: Settings
section.paragraph: Specific displays can be configured individually, e.g., a second actual speed.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Live Vehicle is a virtual representation of your own vehicle with different information, e.g., vehicle status or energy flow indicators.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Appropriate information is shown on the Control Display depending on the driving situation. Fault statuses are not taken into account.

section.title: Adaptive content
section.paragraph: The following content is displayed in alternating order and, if necessary, depending on the selected drive mode:

section.title: Static information
section.paragraph: The following information may be shown permanently on the control display regardless of the driving situation and driving mode set.

section.title: Adjusting the display
section.paragraph: In the Live Vehicle menu, you can choose between an adaptive display with changing content and static content.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting:

item.paragraph: "Adaptive content": different content is displayed in varying order.
"Trip data": Trip data is permanently displayed.
"Vehicle status": Vehicle status is permanently displayed.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The Head-up display projects important information in the driver's field of view, for instance the speed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The views on the Head-up display adjust automatically depending on the selected driving mode.
Depending on vehicle equipment, the height of the Head-up display can be stored using the memory function.
Follow instructions for cleaning the Head-up display in the Vehicle Care chapter.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The protective glass of the Head-up display is located between the steering wheel and the windshield.

section.title: Configuring a view
section.paragraph: The views for the Head-up Display can be set independently of the display on the instrument cluster, e.g., a reduced view.

action-step.paragraph: Press the button on the steering wheel.
A menu bar is displayed in the instrument cluster.
Select the menu using the arrow buttons on the steering wheel where applicable.
Select the menu by tilting the thumbwheel on the steering wheel where applicable.
Select the desired setting using the thumbwheel on the steering wheel.

section.title: Overview
section.paragraph: The following information is displayed on the Head-up display depending on the driving mode selected:
The following information is displayed on the Head-up display:
Some of this information is only displayed briefly as needed.

section.title: Setting the view
section.paragraph: Additional settings can be applied depending on the driving mode selected and the Head-up display configuration.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting.

section.title: Visibility of the display
section.paragraph: The visibility of the displays in the Head-up display is influenced by the following factors:

item.paragraph: Objects on the protective glass of the Head-up display.
Dust or dirt on the protective glass of the Head-up display.
Windshield dirty on inside or outside.

section.paragraph: If the image is distorted, have the base settings checked by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: Settings
section.paragraph: Individual settings can be entered for the Head-up display, such as for the height, brightness or illustration. In addition, individual displays in the Head-up display can be set up separately such as for Driver Assistance.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting.

section.title: Special windshield
section.paragraph: The windshield is part of the system.
The shape and coating of the special windshield enable the system to function.
In the event of damage, have the special windshield replaced by an authorized service center or by another qualified service center or a repair shop.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The meaning of the indicator and warning lights is explained here.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Seat belt on the driver's seat is not buckled.
Indicator light comes on briefly: indicates that the entire airbag system and seat belt tensioners are operational when drive readiness is switched on.
Indicator light illuminates continuously: there is a malfunction. Have the vehicle checked immediately by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
Malfunction in the brake system, braking assistance may be faulty. Continue to drive moderately. Avoid abrupt braking, take longer braking distance into account.
Have the vehicle checked immediately by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
Contact an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
Indicator light illuminates or flashes in conjunction with an acoustic signal if a collision is imminent.
Indicator light illuminates: risk of collision with a person has been detected. Increased awareness is required.
Indicator light flashes and an acoustic signal sounds: collision with a person is imminent. Intervene immediately yourself according to the situation.
Pedestrian Warning with City Collision Mitigation.
Indicator light illuminates: risk of collision, e.g., with a vehicle. Increased awareness is required.
Indicator light flashes and an acoustic signal sounds: collision with a vehicle is imminent. Intervene immediately yourself according to the situation.
Warning function in a rear-end collision situation.
Forward Collision Warning with light braking function.

section.title: Intersection Collision Warning: vehicle detected from the right

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Indicator light illuminates: risk of collision with vehicle crossing from the right has been detected. Increased awareness is required.
Indicator light flashes and an acoustic signal sounds: collision with a crossing vehicle is imminent. Intervene immediately yourself according to the situation.
Intersection warning with City light braking function.

section.title: Intersection Collision Warning: vehicle detected from the left

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Indicator light illuminates: risk of collision with crossing vehicle from the left has been detected. Increased awareness is required.
Indicator light flashes and an acoustic signal sounds: collision with a crossing vehicle is imminent. Intervene immediately yourself according to the situation.
Intersection warning with City light braking function.

title.pcdata-case: Active Cruise Control with Distance Control

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Indicator light flashes and an acoustic signal sounds: braking and evading.
Active Cruise Control with Distance Control.
Depending on the national-market version: steering wheel icon flashes red or lights up red. A signal sounds:
Depending on the national-market version: steering wheel icon flashes red or lights up red. A signal sounds:
The indicator light lights up and an acoustic signal may sound: a system interruption is imminent.
The indicator warning light flashes: lane boundary driven over.
The indicator light lights up and an acoustic signal may sound: a system interruption is imminent.
The indicator warning light flashes: lane boundary driven over.
System malfunction. Steerability is limited during emergency braking.
Avoid abrupt braking. Take the longer braking distance into account.
Have the system immediately checked by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: Forward Collision Mitigation is limited or has malfunctioned

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version: function restriction detected, e.g., due to low sun or because the system has failed. You may continue driving. If necessary, follow the instructions from Check Control messages.
Depending on the equipment and national-market version: the system is turned off.

section.title: Dynamic Stability Control is adjusting, restricted, or has failed

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Indicator light pulsates: Dynamic Stability Control controls the drive and brake forces. The vehicle is stabilized. Reduce speed and modify your driving style to the driving circumstances.
Indicator light is illuminated: Dynamic Stability Control has malfunctioned or is initializing. No driving stabilization.
Have the system immediately checked by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

title.pcdata-case: The Dynamic Stability Control deactivated or the Dynamic Traction Control activated
The Dynamic Stability Control limited or increased driving dynamics activated
The Dynamic Stability Control deactivated or increased driving dynamics activated

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The Dynamic Stability Control is deactivated or the Dynamic Traction Control is activated.
Dynamic Stability Control is limited, or increased driving dynamics is activated.
Dynamic Stability Control is deactivated, or increased driving dynamics is activated.
The Dynamic Stability Control is deactivated or the M Dynamic Mode is activated.
The flat tire monitor reports tire pressure loss in a tire.
Reduce your speed and stop cautiously. Avoid sudden braking and steering maneuvers.
The indicator light illuminates: the Tire Pressure Monitor reports a low tire pressure or a flat tire. Follow the information in the Check Control message.
The indicator light flashes and is then illuminated continuously: flat tires or tire pressure losses cannot be detected.

item.paragraph: Fault caused by systems or devices with the same radio frequency: after leaving the area of the interference, the system automatically becomes active again.
In the case of tires with special approval: the tire pressure monitor was unable to complete the reset. Reset the system again.
Wheel without wheel electronics installed: have it checked by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop as needed.
Malfunction: have the system checked by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Have the system checked by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
Have the vehicle checked by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

item.paragraph: Emissions are deteriorating. Have the vehicle checked as soon as possible.
The warning light flashes under certain circumstances:
This indicates that there is excessive misfiring in the engine.

Reduce the vehicle speed and have the system checked immediately; otherwise, serious engine misfiring within a brief period can seriously damage emission control components, in particular the catalytic converter.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version:

Indicator light illuminates: function restriction detected, e.g., due to low sun or because the system has failed. You may continue driving. If necessary, follow the instructions from Check Control messages.
Indicator light flashes: a warning is issued. The system does not perform any steering interventions.

section.title: Active Blind Spot Detection is limited or has malfunctioned

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version: function restriction detected, e.g., due to dirty radar sensors or because the system has failed. You may continue driving. If necessary, follow the instructions from Check Control messages.

section.title: Active Blind Spot Detection switched off

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Depending on the equipment and national-market version: the system is turned off.
Rear fog light is switched on.
Acoustic pedestrian protection has malfunctioned. Increased caution when maneuvering.
In case of repeated malfunctions, have the system checked by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
Have the system immediately checked by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
Indicator light blinks: M Traction Control level is changed.
Unusually rapid blinking of the indicator light indicates that a turn signal bulb has failed.
Low beams are switched on and the Automatic High Beam Assistant is activated.
High beams are switched on and off automatically depending on the traffic situation.
Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version:
The indicator light lights up: the system is switched on. A lane boundary has been detected on at least one side of the vehicle and the system is ready to intervene. Warnings will be issued.
The system can perform steering interventions.
Indicator light flashes: a warning is issued. If necessary, the system performs a steering intervention.
Indicator light flashes: the system is performing a steering intervention.
Depending on the equipment and national-market version: the system is turned on. Warnings and, if necessary, steering interventions can occur within the system limits.
The vehicle is ready for driving without starting the combustion engine.

section.title: Automatic Hold: vehicle is held automatically

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Automatic Hold is ready to use. The vehicle is automatically held in place when it is stationary.

section.title: Automatic Hold: vehicle secured against rolling away

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The vehicle is automatically secured against rolling away after stopping.
The indicator light lights up: the system is switched on.
The indicator light flashes: the set speed limit has been exceeded.

title.pcdata-case: Active Cruise Control with Distance Control

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Indicator light illuminates: a vehicle has been detected ahead of you. The vehicle icon goes out if no vehicle in front is detected.
Indicator lamp is blinking: vehicle ahead is driving off.
Active Cruise Control with Distance Control.

Depending on vehicle equipment, the indicator light illuminates green, together with the icon for a cruise control system. Speed Limit Assistant is active and detected speed limits can be applied manually for the displayed system.
The detected speed limit can be applied with the SET button. As soon as the speed limit has been applied, a green checkmark is displayed.
The system supports the driver in keeping the vehicle within the lane.
The system is activated and helps to keep the vehicle in the lane.

section.title: Automatic Lane Change Assistant: lane change in progress

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Arrow icon for lane change green: the system is carrying out a lane change.

section.title: Automatic Lane Change Assistant: lane change not possible

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Gray line for lane boundary on the appropriate side: system detected a lane change request. Lane change not currently possible.

section.title: Automatic Lane Change Assistant: functional requirements not met

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Arrow icon for lane change gray: lane change not possible; functional requirements not met.

section.title: Assisted Driving Plus

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Alternative display, depending on vehicle equipment.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Assisted Driving Plus.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: High beams have been switched on.
High beams have been switched on.
High beams are switched on via the Automatic High Beam Assistant.
Seat belt on the passenger seat or another seat in the vehicle is not buckled.
Indicator light is illuminated: the system is interrupted.

title.pcdata-case: Active Cruise Control with Distance Control

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Indicator light is illuminated: the system is interrupted.

Indicator light flashes: the conditions are not adequate for the system to work. The system was deactivated but applies the brakes until you actively resume control by pressing on the brake pedal or accelerator pedal.
Active Cruise Control with Distance Control.
The system is on standby and does not manipulate steering movements.
System activates automatically as soon as all function conditions are fulfilled.
The system is on standby and does not manipulate steering movements.
System activates automatically as soon as all function conditions are fulfilled.
The system is interrupted and will activate automatically as soon as all functional requirements are met.
Depending on the equipment and national-market version: the system is turned off.
Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version:

Indicator light illuminates: the system is turned on but is not currently available. The system is temporarily not making any steering interventions. At least one functional requirement is not met, e.g. the minimum speed has not been reached. The system is temporarily not making any steering interventions.
Indicator light illuminates: the system is switched off or automatically disabled, e.g., because DSC OFF is enabled.
Indicator light flashes: a warning is issued. The system does not perform any steering interventions.

Depending on the equipment and national-market version: the system is turned on. No warnings can be issued temporarily. At least one functional requirement is not met, e.g. the minimum speed has not been reached.

section.title: Active Blind Spot Detection switched off

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Depending on the equipment and national-market version: the system is turned off.
No Distance Control displayed since the accelerator pedal is being pressed.
Active Cruise Control with Distance Control.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The Check Control system monitors functions in the vehicle and notifies you of faults in the monitored systems.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: A Check Control message is displayed as a combination of indicator or warning lights and text messages in the instrument cluster and, if applicable, in the Head-up display.
In addition, an acoustic signal may sound and a text message may appear on the Control Display.

section.title: Hiding Check Control messages
section.paragraph: An arrow icon next to the Check Control message indicates whether the Check Control message can be hidden.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Tilt the thumbwheel on the steering wheel to the left to hide Check Control messages.
To hide Check Control messages, press the left arrow button on the steering wheel.

section.title: Continuous display
section.paragraph: Some Check Control messages are displayed continuously and are not cleared until the fault is eliminated. If several faults occur at once, the messages are displayed consecutively.
Permanently displayed Check Control messages can be hidden temporarily. These messages are automatically displayed again after approx. 8 seconds.

section.title: Temporary display
section.paragraph: Some Check Control messages are hidden automatically after approx. 20 seconds. The Check Control messages are stored and can be displayed again later.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired text message.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: At least one Check Control message is displayed or stored.

section.title: Text messages
section.paragraph: Text messages in combination with an icon in the instrument cluster explain a Check Control message and the meaning of the indicator/warning lights.

section.title: Supplementary text messages
section.paragraph: Additional information, such as the cause of a fault or the required action, can be called up via Check Control.
With urgent text messages, the added text will be automatically displayed on the control display.
Depending on the Check Control message, further help can be selected.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired text message.
Select the desired setting.

section.title: Messages after trip completion
section.paragraph: Certain messages displayed while driving are displayed again after drive-ready state is switched off.

section.title: Speedometer
section.paragraph: The speedometer is displayed in the following driving modes:

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The digital speedometer is permanently displayed in all driving modes. The speed currently driven is displayed.

section.title: Adjusting the unit
section.paragraph: Depending on the national-market version, it may be possible to set the unit for the digital tachometer.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Lists can be displayed and, if necessary, used for certain functions in the instrument cluster or the Head-up display.

item.paragraph: List of most recent telephone calls.

section.paragraph: If necessary, the corresponding menu will open on the Control Display.

section.title: Displaying and using the list
section.paragraph: The selection lists can be displayed and operated using the operating elements on the steering wheel.

entry.paragraph: Pressing the button again will close the currently displayed list.
Show list of most recent telephone calls.
Turn the knurled wheel: display the list for currently selected entertainment source or scroll up or down in the list.
Tilt knurled wheel in corresponding direction: Move selection to left or right.
Turn the knurled wheel: display the entertainment list or scroll up or down in the list.
Press the corresponding arrow key to change the entertainment source.
Show list of most recent telephone calls.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: After opening the entertainment source, tilt the thumbwheel to the left or right as needed to change sources. Press the thumbwheel to confirm the selection.
To change the track or entertainment source after bringing up the entertainment list, use the arrow buttons on the steering wheel. Press the thumbwheel to confirm the selection.
Turn the thumbwheel up or down to select the desired entry in the list. Press the thumbwheel to confirm the selection.
Depending on the equipment version, the list in the instrument cluster may differ from the illustration.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The shift point indicator recommends the gear that best suits the current driving situation. Using the optimal gear supports an efficient driving style.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The gear shift indicator is active in manual mode M depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version.
Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version, the gear shift indicator is active in sequential mode of the M Steptronic Sport transmission and with manual transmission.

entry.paragraph: Shift up to the most fuel efficient gear.

section.title: Displays
section.paragraph: Information on upshifts or downshifts or the engaged gear is displayed in the instrument cluster.
On vehicles without a gear shift indicator, the engaged gear is displayed.

entry.paragraph: With shift paddles: temporary manual mode.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Shift paddles.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The power gauge indicates the currently drawn drive power as a percentage.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: In COMFORT and ECO PRO drive modes:
Needle in the area of arrow 1: display of the energy recovered by coasting or when decelerating.
Needle near arrow 2: Drive power in percent.

section.title: Energy recovery display

entry.paragraph: Selector lever position D is engaged.
Selector lever position D is engaged.
Selector lever position D or B is set.

section.paragraph: The degree of the energy recovery depends on the settings for the energy recovery.
Additional information:
Driving in detail: eDRIVE.

section.title: Reduced drive power
section.paragraph: The available power may be reduced due to certain factors. The power gauge is automatically adjusted accordingly.
In addition, the icons on the power gauge indicate reduced drive power:
In addition, the icons on the power gauge and tachometer indicate reduced drive power.

entry.paragraph: White icon: increased drive system temperature, for instance due to sustained or high power demand when driving on mountain roads.
Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version:
Drive power limitation defined via the BMW Digital Key.
Zero emission zone: Only the electric drive is available.
A Check Control message is displayed in addition where applicable.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The power gauge indicates the currently drawn drive power as a percentage.

section.title: Enabling/disabling the power gauge
section.paragraph: The power display or tachometer is shown depending on the driving mode selected or the individual configuration of the layout.
The power display for hybrid drive or the combustion engine speed is shown depending on the driving mode selected or the individually configured layout.

section.title: Display

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Needle in range of arrow 1: display for energy recovery such as while decelerating CHARGE.
Needle in range of arrow 2: the drive power in percent, POWER.
Needle near arrow 1: indicator for energy recovery, e.g., while decelerating.
Needle near arrow 2: range for electric driving.
Arrow 3: mark for current maximum available electric power.
Needle near arrow 4: combustion engine switched on.

section.paragraph: The electric driving range is variable and may change depending on the driving situation.

section.title: Reduced drive power
section.paragraph: The available power may be reduced due to certain factors. The power gauge is automatically adjusted accordingly.
In addition, the icons on the power gauge indicate reduced drive power:
In addition, the icons on the power gauge and tachometer indicate reduced drive power.

entry.paragraph: White icon: increased drive system temperature, for instance due to sustained or high power demand when driving on mountain roads.
Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version:
Drive power limitation defined via the BMW Digital Key.
Zero emission zone: Only the electric drive is available.
A Check Control message is displayed in addition where applicable.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The engine has a permissible speed range. Excessive speeds are indicated by a yellow prewarning field and a red warning field. The permissible speed increases as the engine oil temperature increases.

The engine has a permissible speed range. Excessive speeds are indicated by a yellow prewarning field and a red warning field. The permitted speed increases as the engine oil temperature increases and as the emission control system temperature increases.
Always avoid RPM in the red warning field. In this range, the fuel supply is reduced to protect the engine.
The tachometer is displayed depending on the selected drive mode or the individually configured layout.
The tachometer display changes depending on the selected driving mode.

section.title: Reduced engine speed range
section.paragraph: The available engine speed range may be reduced due certain factors such as a cold drive system. The tachometer display is automatically adjusted depending on the available engine speed range.
The available engine speed range may be reduced due certain factors such as a cold drive system. The tachometer display is automatically adjusted depending on the available engine speed range.
In addition, icons in the tachometer indicate a reduced speed range.

section.title: Standby state and drive-ready state

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The lettering OFF in the instrument cluster indicates that drive-ready state is switched off and standby state is switched on.
The READY message in the instrument cluster indicates that the Auto Start/Stop function is ready to start the engine automatically.
When the drive-ready state is switched on, READY is displayed in the instrument cluster.

section.paragraph: Additional information:

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The expected range for the energy stored in the high-voltage battery is continuously displayed in the instrument cluster.
Always make sure that the range is sufficient for the planned trip. The range is dynamic and can abruptly change.
The range can be reduced or increased based on the following factors:

item.paragraph: After determination of a route through the navigation system depending on the route profile, route distance and selected speed.
When exiting a route or recalculating a route.
By preheating/precooling the high-voltage battery with active guidance to a DC charging station.

section.paragraph: Information about the current range can be displayed in the instrument cluster.
Check Control messages indicate a limited range.
Additional information:

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The range is continuously displayed in the instrument cluster.

section.title: Range with active guidance
section.paragraph: The icon is displayed next to the range when guidance was started in the navigation system. Information from the navigation system is taken into account for the calculation of the current range.

section.title: Heavily discharged high-voltage battery

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The high-voltage battery is heavily discharged. The drive power will be reduced. Heating and climate control functions will be deactivated.

section.paragraph: In this state, the exact range can no longer be calculated. A short range may still be available depending on the ambient conditions.
Re-establishing the drive-ready state can help increase the range slightly, for instance to remove the vehicle from a hazardous area.

section.title: State of charge in strong temperature fluctuations
section.paragraph: In the case of strong temperature fluctuations and a low state of charge of the high-voltage battery, it may not be possible to start the vehicle again at the beginning of the next trip. Recharge vehicle with a low state of charge in time.

section.title: Charge state indicator and electric range
Principle
section.paragraph: The charge state indicator is displayed together with the electric range.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Various factors are taken into account when calculating the electric range. The electric range value is adapted dynamically.
The following factors, for example, are taken into account when calculating the range:
The total range is given by the electric range together with the range of the combustion engine.
Additional information:
Fuel gauge and total range.

warning.paragraph: Even when it is indicated that the high-voltage battery is discharged, the high-voltage system is always still under high voltage. There is a risk of fire or a risk of injury. Do not touch or change live parts, e.g., orange high-voltage cables, even when the batteries are discharged.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Charge level indicator of high-voltage battery, arrow 2.
Arrow icon for the vehicle side on which the charging socket cover is located, arrow 3.
The display indicates that the high-voltage battery is almost fully discharged or the electric drive is currently not available.

section.title: Display

item.paragraph: Cold engine: the needle is in the blue temperature range, close to the stop of the temperature display, and the text WARM-UP is displayed.
Drive at moderate RPM and vehicle speeds.
Normal operating temperature: the needle is in the middle or in the left half of the temperature display.
Hot engine: the needle is in the red temperature range. In addition, a Check Control message is displayed.
Cold engine: the bar display is in the blue temperature range.
Drive at moderate RPM and vehicle speeds.
Normal operating temperature: the bar display is in the middle of the temperature display.
Hot engine: the bar display is in the upper temperature range. In addition, a Check Control message is displayed.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Coolant level.

section.title: Indicator light in the instrument cluster

graphic-with-description.paragraph: A red indicator light is displayed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: If the indicator drops to +3℃+3℃, +37℉+37℉/+3℃ or lower, a signal sounds.
A Check Control message is displayed.
There is an increased risk of ice on roads.

overview.overview-text: Adjust driving style to weather conditions

warning.paragraph: Even at temperatures above +3 ℃+3 ℃, 37 ℉+37 ℉/+3 ℃ there is a risk of icy roads, for instance on bridges or shady sections of the road. There is a risk of accident. Modify your driving style to the weather conditions at low temperatures.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The charging screen displays information about the charging process in the instrument cluster.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Some of the displays in the instrument cluster may differ from the illustrations in the Owner's Manual.
When the vehicle is locked, the most important information is displayed for a short period of time.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: With the charging cable plugged in, press the button on the vehicle key.
The function is not available for the first 10 seconds after locking.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Charge vehicle.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Shift lights are temporarily displayed on the instrument cluster and indicate the appropriate time to upshift in order to achieve rapid acceleration.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The shift lights are active in manual mode M and can be displayed on the instrument cluster or on the Head-up display in combination with the tachometer.

section.title: Functional requirements

item.paragraph: "SPORT": The driving mode must be selected depending on vehicle equipment.
To display the shift lights on the Head-up display, select Sport view.
Manual mode M must be activated.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Advanced mode.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Successive fields illuminating yellow indicate an upcoming shift point.

item.paragraph: Shift when all fields illuminate red at the latest.
When the maximum RPM is reached, the entire display flashes red and the fuel supply is interrupted in order to protect the engine.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Shift lights are temporarily displayed on the instrument cluster and indicate the appropriate time to upshift in order to achieve rapid acceleration.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Successive fields illuminating yellow indicate the upcoming shift point.
Shift when all fields illuminate red at the latest.
When the maximum RPM is reached, the entire display flashes red and the fuel supply is interrupted in order to protect the engine.

section.title: Functional requirement
section.paragraph: If the vehicle is equipped with an M Steptronic Sport transmission, sequential mode must be selected to display the shift lights.

section.title: Shift lights in the instrument cluster

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The shift lights are displayed on the instrument cluster in all driving modes.
The shift lights on the instrument cluster are only displayed if the Head-up Display is disabled.
If the Head-up Display is enabled, the shift lights are displayed on the Head-up Display.

section.title: Shift lights in the Head-up Display

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The shift lights, arrow 1, are displayed above the tachometer, arrow 2.

section.paragraph: The shift lights are shown on the Head-up display in the following driving modes:

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The following settings can be selected:
The following settings are available depending on the driving mode selected:
Some contents for the central display range can also be configured as a view in the Head-up display.
Additional information:
Head-Up Display.

section.title: Configuring the central display range
section.paragraph: The content of the central display range on the instrument cluster can be configured individually, for instance the trip data display.

action-step.paragraph: Press the button on the steering wheel.
A menu bar is displayed in the instrument cluster.
Select the menu using the arrow buttons on the steering wheel where applicable.
Select the menu by tilting the thumbwheel on the steering wheel where applicable.
Select the desired setting using the thumbwheel on the steering wheel.

section.title: M Setup display
section.paragraph: Some of the settings saved on the M menu can be displayed in the central display range of the instrument cluster.

section.title: Tire data
section.paragraph: Information about wheels and tires can be displayed on the instrument cluster.

section.title: Engine data
section.paragraph: Coolant temperature and boost pressure of the exhaust turbocharger can be displayed on the instrument cluster.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The trip data display provides various information about the trip, e.g., average consumption or trip distance.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The trip data can be displayed on the Control Display and in the instrument cluster.
Depending on the setting in the Live Vehicle menu, the trip data is shown dynamically or permanently on the control display.
The values can be displayed and reset depending on different intervals.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The following trip data is shown on the control display:

item.paragraph: Configured interval for displaying trip data.
Average fuel consumption depending on the configured interval.
Average consumption depending on the configured interval.
Average electrical consumption depending on the configured interval.
Travel time depending on the configured interval.
Distance traveled depending on the configured interval.
Counter for energy recovery depending on the configured interval.
Odometer for driving without a combustion engine.

section.title: Display in the instrument cluster
section.paragraph: Information on consumption and distance covered can be displayed in the instrument cluster.

item.paragraph: Distance traveled depending on the configured interval, arrow 3.
The icon is displayed when the vehicle is in Coasting mode.
Distance traveled depending on the interval set, arrow 5.

section.title: Current consumption
section.paragraph: The current fuel consumption display allows you to check the current fuel consumption, e.g., to drive economically and in an environmentally-friendly manner.
The current consumption display allows you to check the current energy consumption, e.g., to drive efficiently.
The current consumption display allows you to check the current energy consumption and the current fuel consumption, e.g., to drive efficiently.

Mild hybrid technology: Depending on vehicle equipment, the fuel supply is interrupted and the engine continues to run when driving slowly or even when the vehicle is stationary. In this case, the internal combustion engine is operated electrically.

section.title: Average fuel consumption
section.paragraph: The average consumption is displayed depending on how the intervals for displaying trip data are configured.
The average consumption is determined on the basis of various distances.

section.title: Adjusting the display of the trip data
section.paragraph: The intervals for the display of the trip data in the instrument cluster and on the Control Display are adjustable.
Using the button on the left steering column switch:

action-step.paragraph: Press the button.
The trip data is displayed.
Press button repeatedly until the desired setting is displayed.

section.paragraph: Via iDrive:

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting:

item.paragraph: "Since start of trip ( )": the values are automatically reset approx. four hours after the vehicle has come to a standstill.
"Since last refuel ( )": the values are automatically reset after refueling with a larger quantity of fuel.
"Since last charge ( )": the values are automatically reset after charging.
"Since factory": the values since the time of the factory delivery are displayed.
"Since Individual ( )": the values since the last manual reset are displayed. The values can be reset at any time.

section.title: Resetting average values manually
section.paragraph: The following interval can be reset manually at any time:
Using the thumbwheel on the steering wheel:

action-step.paragraph: Display trip data in the instrument cluster.
Press and hold theknurled wheel on the steering wheel until the values are reset.

section.paragraph: Using the button on the left steering column switch:

action-step.paragraph: Press the button.
The trip data is displayed.
Press and hold the button until the values are reset.

section.paragraph: The g-meter values can also be reset manually using the BC button.
The g-meter values can also be reset manually using the knurled wheel on the steering wheel.
Additional information:
G-meter.
Via iDrive:
The average values and counters are reset. Once the average values and counters have been reset, the following interval is automatically activated:

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: With Assisted View, information on driver assistance systems can be displayed on the instrument cluster with a vehicle animation.
Information on parking and maneuvering is displayed in the Assisted View whenever the parking assistance system is active.
Assisted View is available in the following driving mode:

overview.overview-text: Observe surrounding traffic and adapt driving style

warning.paragraph: The system cannot serve as a substitute for the driver’s personal judgment in assessing the traffic situation. Based on the limits of the system, it cannot independently react to all traffic situations. There is a risk of accident. Adjust driving style to traffic conditions. Watch the surrounding traffic situation closely, be ready to take over steering and braking at any time, and actively intervene where appropriate.

section.title: Permanent display
section.paragraph: You can configure how Assisted View is displayed on the central display range and have it shown permanently.
Additional information:

section.title: Temporary display
section.paragraph: With the temporary display, Assisted View is always shown when driver assistance systems are active, regardless of how the central display range is configured.

paragraph.textref: "Display Assisted View when Driver Assistance is active"

section.title: Display
section.paragraph: An example with active Driver Assistance: the indicator and warning lights for the distance control and the Automatic Lane Change Assistant indicate a lane change to the next lane. At the same time, the lane change to the next lane is shown with animation in the Assisted View.

An example with active Driver Assistance: the indicator and warning lights for the distance control and the Automatic Lane Change Assistant indicate a lane change to the next lane. At the same time, the lane change to the next lane is shown with animation in the Assisted View.

section.title: System limits
section.paragraph: The system's detection capability is limited.
Only objects that are detected by the system are taken into account.
The system may indicate something wrong.
Additional information:

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The G-meter indicates the forces that are applied in longitudinal and transverse direction on the vehicle occupants while driving.
The display can be configured on the central display range of the instrument cluster.
The values are automatically reset whenever you start a new drive.
Additional information:

action-step.paragraph: Display the g-meter on the instrument cluster.
Press and hold theknurled wheel on the steering wheel until the values are reset.
Display the g-meter on the instrument cluster.
Press and hold the button on the left steering column until the values are reset.

section.title: Date and time
section.paragraph: Various settings can be applied for the date and time display such as the date format.

Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version, the time zone can be set and automatic time setting can be activated. With automatic time setting, the time, date and, if necessary, the time zone are updated automatically.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired settings.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The current fill level of the fuel tank is displayed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Vehicle inclination may cause the display to vary.
Additional information:
Refueling.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: An arrow beside the fuel pump icon shows which side of the vehicle the fuel filler flap is on.
The current range is displayed as numerical value.

section.title: Indicator light in the instrument cluster

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The yellow indicator light illuminates, once the fuel reserve is reached.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The current fill level of the fuel tank is displayed together with the total range.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Vehicle inclination may cause the display to vary.
Additional information:
Refueling.

warning.paragraph: With a range below 50 km50 km, approx. 30 miles30 miles/50 km, the engine may no longer have sufficient fuel. Engine functions are not ensured anymore. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Refuel promptly.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Current fill level of fuel tank, arrow 2.
Arrow icon for the vehicle side on which the fuel filler flap is located, arrow 3.

section.title: Indicator light in the instrument cluster

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The yellow indicator light illuminates, once the fuel reserve is reached.

section.title: Overall range
section.paragraph: The total range considers the contents of the fuel tank as well as the electric energy in the high-voltage battery. If the prerequisites for electric driving are not met, the total range considers the content of the fuel tank only.
With a low remaining range, a Check Control message is briefly displayed. A low remaining range means that engine functions cannot always be ensured for sporty driving, e.g., when cornering at speed.
The Check Control message appears continuously below a range of approx. 50 km50 km, approx. 30 miles30 miles/50 km.
Additional information:

paragraph.link: Battery charge indicator and electric range

warning.paragraph: Even when it is indicated that the high-voltage battery is discharged, the high-voltage system is always still under high voltage. There is a risk of fire or a risk of injury. Do not touch or change live parts, e.g., orange high-voltage cables, even when the batteries are discharged.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: When standby and drive readiness are turned on, the available battery charge state of the high-voltage battery is continuously displayed in percent in the instrument cluster.
An arrow next to the battery icon indicates the vehicle side on which the charging socket cover is located.
In case of temperature fluctuations, the battery charge state may change.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The range indicates the distance that can still be covered with the current tank of fuel.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The estimated range with remaining fuel is permanently displayed on the instrument cluster.
With a low remaining range, a Check Control message is briefly displayed. A low remaining range means that engine functions cannot always be ensured for sporty driving, e.g., when cornering at speed.
The Check Control message appears continuously below a range of approx. 50 km50 km, approx. 30 miles30 miles/50 km.

warning.paragraph: With a range below 50 km50 km, approx. 30 miles30 miles/50 km, the engine may no longer have sufficient fuel. Engine functions are not ensured anymore. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Refuel promptly.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The current range is displayed as a numerical value next to the fuel gauge.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The range prediction indicates the extent to which the range can be influenced with the current driving style. This supports an efficient driving style.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The current range is influenced by many factors, including speed.

The range trend shows the expected development of the range with the current driving style. The range trend is based on the average consumption that is calculated for the directly traveled route section.
Additional information:

item.paragraph: Possible range with very low energy consumption, arrow 3.
Possible range with very high energy consumption, arrow 4.

section.title: Range prediction with active guidance
section.paragraph: With active guidance, the distance to the destination and the expected charge state of the high-voltage battery when the destination is reached are also displayed.

entry.paragraph: The expected battery charge state when the destination is reached is displayed next to the icon.
The icon is displayed when route guidance to a charging post was started on the navigation system.
The icon is displayed when route guidance was restarted on the navigation system. Information from the navigation system is taken into account for the calculation of the current range.

section.title: Setting the units of measurement
section.paragraph: Depending on the national-market version, you can set the units of measurement for some values, for instance consumption, distances, and temperature.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The status can be displayed and actions performed for several systems, such as for Check Control.
Depending on the setting, the vehicle status is displayed dynamically or continuously on the Control Display.

entry.paragraph: "Flat Tire Monitor": Status of the flat tire monitor.
"Tire Pressure Monitor": status of the Tire Pressure Monitor.
"AdBlue": BMW Advanced DieselBMW Diesel with BluePerformance.
"Check Control": displaying stored Check Control messages.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The current driving condition is displayed dynamically while driving in the Live Vehicle menu on the control display.
The following states can be displayed:

item.paragraph: Additional information on electric driving is displayed depending on the situation.
Depending on the situation, additional information on adaptive recuperation is displayed.
Efficient rolling with engine switched off.

section.paragraph: With mild hybrid technology:

item.paragraph: Depending on the situation, additional information on adaptive recuperation is displayed.
Efficient rolling with engine switched off.

section.paragraph: Additional information:

item.paragraph: Personal Mode or Efficient Mode drive mode must be selected.
COMFORT or ECO PRO drive mode must be selected.
The following driving mode must be selected:
With Live Vehicle, the following setting must be selected:

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The adaptive recuperation is active, arrow 1.
The high-voltage battery is charged when the vehicle is decelerating, arrow 2.
The vehicle battery is charged when the vehicle decelerates, arrow 2.
The vehicle battery is charged when the vehicle decelerates.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The Sport displays especially support a sporty driving style.

item.paragraph: SPORT drive mode must be selected.
One of the following driving modes must be selected:
With Live Vehicle, the following setting must be selected:

section.paragraph: The sport displays are displayed in the Live Vehicle menu on the control display.
The following information is displayed:

section.title: Display in the instrument cluster
section.paragraph: Sport displays can be shown in the central display area of the instrument cluster. Sport displays include information on power and torque.
Additional information:

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The function displays the service notifications and the corresponding maintenance scopes.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: After turning on the drive readiness, the next service appointment or the distance remaining until the next service is displayed briefly in the instrument cluster.
A service advisor can read out the current service notifications from your vehicle key.

section.title: Display
section.paragraph: More information on the type of service required may be displayed on the Control Display.

action-step.paragraph: Maintenance work and legally mandated inspections are displayed.
Select a desired entry to call up detailed information.

section.title: Entering appointment dates
section.paragraph: Dates for mandatory vehicle inspections can be entered.
Make sure that the vehicle's date and time are set correctly.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Performed maintenance can be displayed on the Control Display.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Have maintenance work performed by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop. Performed maintenance work is entered into the vehicle data. The function is available as soon as a maintenance has been entered in the vehicle data.

action-step.paragraph: Maintenance and service measures and legally mandated inspections are displayed.
Select an entry to call up detailed information.

entry.paragraph: Maintenance was carried out on time.

section.title: ETC system
section.paragraph: Information about the ETC system on the rear of the interior mirror is included in the supplemental operating instructions for the ETC system in the interior mirror.

action-step.paragraph: Make the desired settings.
